str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Dealing with other men, conduct, life, behavior, manner of life. From anastrepho; behavior.
